programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady's 200th victory as a starting QB with 340 yards and a touchdown and ran for another score. Patrick Mahomes finished 23 of 36 for 352 yards in his first loss as a starting quarterback, with three of his four TD passes going to Tyreek Hill.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Minnesota Vikings visited the Buffalo Bills for a wild-OT game in Week 10 where the Vikings rallied from a 17-point second-half deficit, and a heroic performance by Justin Jefferson, career high 193 yards and an incredible, game-saving one-handed grab.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: During the Cincinnati Bengals' Week 17 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs (34-31), wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase turned in an impressive stat line: 11 receptions, 266 receiving yards and three touchdowns. With this performance, he rewrote the NFL record for most receiving yards by a rookie in a game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the Week 8, 2016 matchup between the Oakland Raiders and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers where quarterback Derek Carr finished with a franchise-record 513 yards passing, completing 40 of 59 passes without an interception.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Ben Roethlisberger ended the game the way he started it by throwing a touchdown pass to Mike Wallace, a desperation 19-yarder on the final play that rallied Pittsburgh to a 37-36 victory over Green Bay on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Younghoe Koo's 52-yard field goal as time expired in regulation forced overtime, and Cousins took care of the rest as he set a franchise record with 509 passing yards to lift Atlanta (3-2) into a tie atop the division.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Stepping up in mop-up duty, backup quarterback Matt Flynn capped his 480-yard and six-touchdown performance with a go-ahead touchdown pass to Jermichael Flynn with 1:10 left to give the Packers a 45-41 road win over the Detroit Lions.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady barely outdueled Peyton Manning in their annual meeting, leading the New England Patriots past the Indianapolis Colts 31-28.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Lamar Jackson had 3 fourth-quarter TD passes, and the Ravens stopped the Bengals on a 2-point conversion with 38 seconds remaining to hold them 35-34 on Thursday night. The Ravens rallied from a 21-7 third-quarter deficit.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rookie Andrew Luck capped a second-half comeback by throwing a 4-yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne with 35 seconds to go that gave Indianapolis a stunning 30-27 victory over Green Bay on Sunday in the Colts' first game without coach Chuck Pagano.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Matt Ryan threw for 291 yards, rookie Julio Jones caught 11 passes for 127 yards, and the Atlanta Falcons held off a second-half rally from Seattle for a 30-28 win over the Seahawks.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Running back Ezekiel Elliott continues to dominate, as he wins the game for the Dallas Cowboys in their Week 10 matchup against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The New England Patriots stormed back from a 24-0 halftime deficit to beat the Denver Broncos 34-31 in a contest that finished early Monday morning and deep into overtime. It was the biggest comeback of Brady's career.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rob Bironas kicked a 26-yard field goal in overtime, and the Titans stopped backup quarterback Shaun Hill on fourth down to finally pull out a 44-41 win over the Detroit Lions.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: DeSean Jackson scored on a 65-yard punt return on the final play of the game and the Philadelphia Eagles scored 28 points in the final 7:28 to stun the New York Giants 38-31 Sunday and take over first place in the NFC East.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady's 200th victory as a starting QB with 340 yards and a touchdown and ran for another score. Patrick Mahomes finished 23 of 36 for 352 yards in his first loss as a starting quarterback, with three of his four TD passes going to Tyreek Hill.

programme.title: 1968 Southern 500 at Darlington Raceway
programme.desc: The 1968 Southern 500 at Darlington Raceway saw Wood Brothers Racing dominate, securing the win after battling through seven cautions in a tough 501-mile race.

programme.title: 1968 Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speedway
programme.desc: The 1968 Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speedway saw Wood Brothers Racing dominate, leading 142 of 160 laps to secure a commanding victory in the July 4 classic.

programme.title: 1969 Atlanta 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway
programme.desc: The 1969 Atlanta 500 at Atlanta International Raceway featured fast speeds and fierce competition in a classic NASCAR Grand National showdown.

programme.title: 1991 Champion Spark Plug 400 at Michigan International Speedway
programme.desc: The 1991 Champion Spark Plug 400 at Michigan featured a thrilling photo finish, delivering intense NASCAR Cup Series action and a memorable first-time winner.

programme.title: Survival of the Fastest
programme.desc: An in-depth look at Wood Brothers Racing as the team prepares for the 2007 race in Michigan.

programme.title: 2025 Cracker Barrel 400 at Nashville SuperSpeedway
programme.desc: A very popular driver finally turned his luck around with his first Cup Series win of the 2025 season at Nashville Superspeedway, leading 139 laps.

programme.title: 1965 Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speedway
programme.desc: On Independence Day 1965, the Firecracker 400 ignited Daytona’s high banks with a blistering display of speed and strategy in NASCAR’s premier series.

programme.title: 1965 American 500 at Rockingham Speedway
programme.desc: The 1965 American 500 at Rockingham debuted as a 500-mile NASCAR Grand National race, attracting 35,000 fans to the new North Carolina Motor Speedway.

programme.title: 1967 Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speedway
programme.desc: The 1967 Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speedway saw Wood Brothers Racing dominate, leading 30 laps and securing a commanding victory in the July 4 classic.

programme.title: 1968 Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway
programme.desc: The 1968 Daytona 500 saw Wood Brothers Racing dominate, leading 76 laps and securing a commanding victory in the 10th running of NASCAR's premier event.

programme.title: 2025 NASCAR Cup Series Wurth 400 at Texas Motor Speedway
programme.desc: The 2025 NASCAR Cup Series heats up as top drivers battle it out at the Wurth 400 at Texas Motor Speedway. Late race restarts kept fans on the edge.

programme.title: 2025 NASCAR Cup Series Adventhealth 400 at Kansas Speedway
programme.desc: Action-packed racing returns to Kansas Speedway for the Adventhealth 400 as the 2025 NASCAR Cup Series heats up. Air-blocking and wild restarts are crucial.

programme.title: 2025 Cook Out Clash

programme.title: 2025 February Daytona 500
programme.desc: The 2025 Daytona 500 is a thrilling NASCAR race marking the start of the NASCAR Cup season with fierce competition and intense drafting on the legendary track.

programme.title: 2025 February Atlanta Cup

programme.title: 2025 Tewaaraton Award Ceremony
programme.desc: From the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, DC, comes the 25th annual Tewaaraton Award Ceremony. The prestigious Tewaaraton Award Ceremony honors the top collegiate lacrosse players in the country. Join us for an intimate evening with this year's Tewaaraton Legend Award honorees, Gary and Paul Gait, and the Tewaaraton Spirit Award honorees, Mike and Paul Rabil, and witness history as the 2025 winners are announced and awarded for their outstanding achievements.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #8: $25,000 Pot-Limit Omaha final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! John Riordan is the chip leader ahead of Alex Livingston, Sean Winter, Tony Bloom, Matthew Wantman, and Sam Soverel, as the final six play for the $360,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #9: $25,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Justin Bonomo is the chip leader ahead of Seth Davies, Sean Winter, Jason Koon, Brian Rast, and Nick Schulman, as the final six play for the $432,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark

programme.title: You Made Me This Way
programme.desc: Haunted by a failed assassination attempt, ruthless drug lord Kwame becomes obsessed with Aubrey, the woman who nearly ended his life. Consumed by revenge, he kidnaps her, setting in motion a deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: Dream on Dreamer
programme.desc: Mario's life unravels when he quits med school for acting, angering his wife, Erica, who leaves with their daughter. His friend Derrick faces his own crisis with his side chick. Desperate, they turn to Mario's drug-dealing brother, Paul. This leads them into the dangerous world of Queen Pin Malkia, where their lives are put at risk.

programme.title: The Green Grass
programme.desc: When a man’s money, success and power attracts attention, he must dig deep within himself to stop his life from spinning wildly out of control.

programme.title: The Killing Secret
programme.desc: A seemingly healthy marriage is threatened by deadly secrets as the couple discovers that smiles can be deceiving, and kisses can be poison.

programme.title: The Love App
programme.desc: Signed up for a new dating app, Rachel, hopeful that she’ll meet her Mr. Right, is presented instead with a suitor who happens to be a serial killer.

programme.title: The Perfect Wife
programme.desc: Following a car crash that claimed her brother’s life, a woman marries the man she blames for the accident only to make his life a living hell.

programme.title: The Perfect Wife 2
programme.desc: Recently widowed and on the rebound, Allan instantly falls for Erica and the two quickly marry, but he soon learns she isn't that all she seems.

programme.title: The Ring Widow
programme.desc: A young couple learn that the woman renting their property is possibly a serial killer targeting married men who cheat on their wives.

programme.title: The Wake Up Call
programme.desc: Upon learning of his father’s cancer diagnosis, a gifted research student dedicates every waking hour to finding a cure.

programme.title: Thicker the Berry, the Sweeter the Juice
programme.desc: A plus-sized woman with no luck in the dating game finds her life taking a sharp turn when she gets involved with the neighborhood bad boy.

programme.title: Twerk: Reggae Nights
programme.desc: Hard-working, single mother, Iesha, learns that one of the most popular reggae artists, Domino, is holding an audition in her city for dancers in his next music video. The competition is fierce, and some of the ladies will do anything to get the job.

programme.title: Kitty Hallow Killer
programme.desc: A serial killer is on the loose in Houston killing pedophiles and rapists. When Mason and Jessica get into a horrible car accident on their wedding day, Jessica wakes up with no memory of her life or even her husband. As her memories start to come back in pieces, she is afraid that her husband, Mason, could be The Kitty Hallow Killer.

programme.title: Troubled Mystic
programme.desc: Tracie is a single mother who meets Corey Daniels, the calculated and "perfect guy" looking for his next perfect family to manipulate by any means necessary.

programme.title: Messy
programme.desc: After being sent away to prison for possessing a firearm, Meek Richardson returns home to the DMV to find out his associate Kevin, is killed. Meek seeks to find the truth about his friend's death, and finds that his enemies are closer than it seems.

programme.title: Thick Trip
programme.desc: Four close-knit friends, all single and yearning for a change, embark on a summer-long 'Queen's Trip' to South Padre, Houston, and the untouched wilderness. As they travel and experience the vibrant cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they confront their fears, rediscover their passions, and explore their own wild sides.

programme.title: Treasure Box
programme.desc: Treasure is Daddy's main girl that holds the house and the other girls down.

programme.title: Unfinished Business
programme.desc: After losing his brother, a local sheriff is on a desperate hunt for vengeance. But a revelation about his past makes him and his daughter targets.

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Shortly after moving to a poor neighborhood in New York City, Victoria's drug-dealing father is killed by local competition. Victoria goes looking for answers, justice and revenge but loses herself along the way.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Well-known rapper Poetic Rhymes goes to jail after a misunderstanding at a bar. He encounters an unusual cell mate that takes control of his mind. After being released from prison, his family notices the changes the hard way.

programme.title: Women of the Jury
programme.desc: On trial for murder, a man's fate hangs in the balance as twelve women jurors argue his case. One juror remains uncertain of the man's guilt.

programme.title: What She Wants
programme.desc: Vannaleese Poole is a street smart, businesswoman who uses her talents to get what she wants. In her quest for power, she falls for two men and becomes embroiled in a web of jealous and deceit.

programme.title: American Girl
programme.desc: A young woman with political and social-justice aspirations finds herself trying to survive on the streets of Atlanta after running away from home.

programme.title: Battered Emotions
programme.desc: Grappling with a breast cancer diagnosis, Rasheada fights to stay strong while her sister and best friend face their own personal battles.

programme.title: Battered Emotions 2
programme.desc: A pregnant woman makes the decision to leave her abusive boyfriend after an act of violence proves to be the last straw for their relationship.

programme.title: Unsecured
programme.desc: Bobby, haunted by the infidelity of his ex-wife, enters a new relationship with Lakeisha while grappling with deep-seated insecurities. Unbeknownst to Lakeisha, his past resurfaces when a witness claims to have seen him involved in a murder.

programme.title: Dreamer on Dreamer 2
programme.desc: Derrick attempts to break it off with his side-chick Keisha, but she thought she was his one and only. That is until she finds out about his fiancé Crystal. To get revenge, Keisha decides to befriend Crystal.

programme.title: The Isiah Factor Uncensored
programme.desc: News anchor and reporter Isiah Carey tackles hot-button news issues with a no-holds-barred attitude.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. programme.desc: Gene stumbles upon a murdered prospector and finds gold while digging the old man's grave. When he reports this, however, he is arrested on suspicion of murder.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene's discovery of a dead man with a silver arrow in his chest leads him to a wrongfully convicted robber, who was framed for his silver mine.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: While Gene and Pat are out investigating numerous holdups, they narrowly escape a landslide trap.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Lanny Gaines and his ailing father have lived in Paradise Valley for several months

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A member of the Castle outlaw gang hears Dale say that "the key to the greatest treasure in the world is in that book"

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Unable to find a job, two young men decide on a life of crime

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Pat is kidnapped by an outlaw gang, one of whom may be in line for a million-dollar inheritance

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy uses a health tonic to prove the innocence of a convicted murderer and the guilt of the real killer.

programme.title: The Command
programme.desc: After Capt. Forsythe (Gregg Barton), the commanding officer of a cavalry troop, is killed in an attack, the new leader is Capt. Robert MacClaw (Guy Madison), a military doctor who has practically no field experience. With assistance from Sgt. Elliott (James Whitmore), MacClaw tries to lead his men to safety, using his ingenuity. But then they are ordered to guide a wagon train, containing the lovely Martha Cutting (Joan Weldon), among others, through dangerous American Indian territory.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A family feud involves Matt when the son is accused of theft.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The corrupt businessmen frames Marshal Matt Wayne for murder when he cracks down on crime

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Jeremy Pitt is employed to represent a ship's crew charged with mutiny.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: When beautiful Lola Montez arrives, it causes quite a stir in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Bandanna Gang is causing a disturbance, so Matt consents to escort some settlers to San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Marshal Wayne suspects fraud when a couple start selling stock in a gold mine.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets sworn in as a U.S. marshal when stage holdups occur.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Prince of Thieves executes a daring robbery in San Francisco.

programme.title: Posse
programme.desc: Texas Marshal Howard Nightingale (Kirk Douglas) aspires to become a U.S. senator and believes that to do so, he must capture the gunslinger Jack Strawhorn (Bruce Dern). Recognizing a dangerous foe, Nightingale gathers a posse of ruthless law enforcers to track him down. His triumph seems imminent after the posse apprehends the outlaw's gang, though Strawhorn himself escapes. Nightingale's confidence is shaken, however, when arresting the elusive bandit proves politically complicated.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Dan Maury, released from Yuma prison, arrives in North Fork intent on getting even with Marshal Torrance, who helped send him to jail.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Pirate queen Coco LaSalle convinces Yancy to back her fighter against the mighty heavyweight called the Tennessee Slasher. While Derringer organizes the illegal fight away from the city administrator's prying eyes, he also searches for a cache of Spencer repeating rifles recently stolen from the federal armory at Port Hudson.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When John Colton is promoted and ordered back to Washington, General Wheeler takes his place with orders to break up a nation-wide counterfeiting gang that is based in New Orleans. However, Yancy objects to General Wheeler's tactics of investigation, particularly the raiding of every gambling house in the city, putting him at odds with the new administrator.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley has been a special marshal to the Texas town of Rio Nada.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill is forced to kill one of the Dawson brothers after a fight when the man draws on him, and then he must contend with three other brothers who vow to kill him.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Working with the railroad, Bill turns down a bribe from a landowner to detour the track through his town, the man then forces a doctor to quarantine the railroad workers.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill finds an old prospector almost dead from thirst, and brings him in to the railroad workers camp.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A group of convicts take over the work train, killing their guards, and hold the entire crew at the construction site hostage.

programme.title: The Texan

programme.desc: Lucas's self-confidence begins to slip away when he misses an easy shot that could have cost Mark his life.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie faces problems at the Lunch Box and must take advice from an unexpected guest.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Skydivers" (1963) Action. A nasty playgirl targets a couple's jump school; with Kevin Casey, Marcia Knight, Eric Tomlin.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Robot Monster" (1953) Science fiction. Earthlings flee from the Ro-Man, a martian in a gorilla suit with a diving helmet. Originally 3-D. With George Nader, Claudia Barrett, Selena Royle.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Star Force: Fugitive Alien II" (1986) Space loner Ken, from Valnastar, guides Earth spaceship Bacchus III on a mission to a far planet.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A hit-and-run victim is brought back from the dead by a voodoo doctor, and then seeks revenge.

programme.title: The Film Crew
programme.desc: The crew watches a film about an island where tribes divided by gender clash with aggressive apes.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Horror cinema icons Bela Lugosi and Tor Johnson star in this Ed Wood classic as the crazed Dr. Vornoff and his beastly assistant Lobo, who conduct heinous experiments on human victims in an effort to create a race of atomic superbeings.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: While trying to resolve a quarrel between warring brothers Eteocles and Polynices, Hercules is taken captive by Queen Omphale of Lydia. Can he escape from the royal court and rescue the woman he loves, before it’s too late?

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Eegah!" (1963) Horror. A prehistoric man abducts a teenage singer's girlfriend.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Jungle Goddess" (1948) Action. Two fortune hunters find a lost heiress running a tribe in Africa. With George Reeves, Wanda McKay, Ralph Byrd.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time Chasers" (1994) Science fiction. A geek makes a time machine from an airplane and a Commodore 64.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: The Towers and Donuts, The Pole Vault, Dogeball, The Barrel Crossing and Double Beams are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beam and Jets, Field Goal Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Donut Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their endurance and bouncability in Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond dons his tuxedo for a special program honouring the heroes of Total Wipeout's fifth series.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beams and Jets, Donut Swing, Big Balls, a Potato Sack, and Barrel Crossing are just some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Log Roll, Wall Swing, The Ring, Tippy Tables, and Cylinder Run are among the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond hosts another episode of TV's stupidest, brightest and most insane game show.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Topple towers, Cookie Cutter, The Tails, Teeter Totters and Crazy Beams are among the over-the-top obstacles on this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ten celebrities from the world of sport and television take on one of the most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's time for 'The Final' of 'Total Wipeout' season 2.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Some of the obstacles the contestants face are the “Bouncy Balls” and “The Sweeper”.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: Will accepts an invitation to a dinner party hosted by his ex-wife and her new husband and begins to suspect an ambush when the affair goes awry.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: "Always expect the unexpected" is the chilling advice a young woman (Bree Turner of TV's GRIMM) thinks about one night on a lonely stretch of mountain road.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: When stressed-out student Walter Gilman rents a room in a decrepit old house, his graduate thesis studies begin to take some very strange twists. He suffers nightmares about a voracious rat with a human face.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: On a desolate stretch of mountain road, a friendly truck driver who enjoys slaughtering hitchhikers meets a charming hitchhiker who prefers to butcher anyone who gives him a ride.

programme.title: Road Games
programme.desc: A laid-back American truck driver in Australia starts to suspect that a man driving a green van killed young women along his route.

programme.title: Horror Bites
programme.desc: Small tales, big terror... In this Horror Bites marathon, bite-sized stories deliver spine-chilling scares in under 20 minutes. From twisted encounters to nightmarish twists, these short horrors pack a punch, proving that sometimes the scariest.

programme.title: Plan 9 From Outer Space
programme.desc: Residents of California's San Fernando Valley are under attack by flying saucers from outer space. The aliens, led by Eros (Dudley Manlove) and his assistant, Tanna (Joanna Lee), intend to conquer the planet by resurrecting corpses in a Hollywood cemetery. The living dead -- a cape-wearing ghoul (Bela Lugosi), a vampire (Vampira) and a slow-footed cop (Tor Johnson) who was killed for his nosiness -- stalk curious humans who wander into the cemetery looking for evidence of the UFOs.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre
programme.desc: A vampire count eyes 19th-century travelers who stop by his Spanish castle.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre: Monstroid
programme.desc: The Mistress of the Dark screens this chemically induced stinker from 1980 after offering a peek behind the curtain at her careful curation process.

programme.title: Uninvited
programme.desc: When a mutated cat escapes a lab study, it becomes the unlikely foil to a shady businessman’s banking scam aboard a yacht headed to the Caribbean.

programme.title: Creepshow III
programme.desc: Macabre tales center on a strange radio, a killer call girl, a haunting, and more in this third installment in an iconic horror anthology series.

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: Sorority sisters are as good as dead when they're stalked by a psychopathic stranger over the Christmas holiday in this influential slasher.

programme.title: Sweet 16
programme.desc: A lonely girl tries to make new friends, but she might spend her 16th birthday alone behind bars, since every boy she meets soon ends up dead.

programme.title: Sorority House Massacre
programme.desc: A college student and her sorority sisters are stalked by an escaped psychopathic killer who shares a strange bond of telepathy with her.

programme.title: Amityville: Dollhouse
programme.desc: A miniature dollhouse replica of an infamous haunted house gifted to a little girl unleashes a full-sized, terrifying evil upon her unprepared family.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: A burned-out cop is demoted to the "weird calls" desk until a series of men are killed by massive blunt-force trauma while in a state of sexual arousal.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: A movie programmer (Norman Reedus of TV's THE WALKING DEAD) searches for the holy grail of cinema, a legendary lost movie whose sole showing drove its audience insane.

programme.title: Eden Lake
programme.desc: A British couple takes a trip to a private and isolated lake quarry for a vacation, only to be targeted by a lurking mob of psychotic teenagers.

programme.title: Horror Bites
programme.desc: Small tales, big terror... In this Horror Bites marathon, bite-sized stories deliver spine-chilling scares in under 20 minutes. From twisted encounters to nightmarish twists, these short horrors pack a punch, proving that sometimes the scariest.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: After a deadly car accident, a young church organist finds herself stalked by mysterious phantoms that beckon her to an abandoned carnival.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre
programme.desc: A widow's son tries to build his own girl at a boarding school in 19th-century France.

programme.title: Dog Soldiers
programme.desc: Deep in the Scotland wilderness during a routine military exercise, British soldiers are plunged into a terrifying nightmare of unlikely enemies.

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: After his brother performs a twisted experiment turning genetically modified sheep into killing machines, a man must stop the madness.

programme.title: Grizzly
programme.desc: A bloodthirsty grizzly bear stalks two estranged brothers (James Marsden, Thomas Jane) in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Fear Itself
programme.desc: A ranch family is destroyed when a Wendigo takes over the body of the father/husband.

programme.title: Fear Itself
programme.desc: Set at a perfect planned community, a young couple, new to the neighborhood, finds out the hard way what can happen if you break any of the community's rules.

programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This week we are celebrating the work of the army of volunteers, which keeps gardens up and down the country looking their best for visitors. Frances Tophill continues her vegetable trials at RHS Rosemoor in Devon, when she plants out her allotment with the help of RHS volunteers and we visit the Bodnant Garden in North Wales to find out how the volunteers there guide visitors through the world famous Laburnum Arch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Tender vegetables, bedding plants and bees are the focus of Monty's gardening at Longmeadow as he plants out squashes and scented annuals, and harvests honey. Adam Frost is in London, looking at how small spaces in the metropolis can be utilised to make gardens for wildlife, food and relaxation. Also, we visit North Wales to meet a man with a passion for prehistoric plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the longest day of the year approaches, there's more time to be outside and enjoy the garden and Monty is no exception. Although some vegetables do not respond well to a late sowing, there are others that do and Monty gives his tips on late croppers to sow now. Carol Klein and Joe Swift make a visit to Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham to revel in the hundreds of summer flowering plants on display and to find design tips for small gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst celebrating the glory of summer flowers at Longmeadow, Monty has plenty of tips, from pruning and propagation techniques for different types of clematis to troubleshooting problems with roses. Carol Klein wades through streams and marshes to show us how gardeners can emulate nature when choosing the right water plants for our gardens, and we visit Norfolk to revel in an extraordinary collection of iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is reaping the rewards of the summer when he begins to harvest crops from the vegetable garden and gives tips on extending the flower season in the borders. Carol takes a trip to the seaside to discover why some plants thrive, despite being assaulted by salt-laden winds. We make a final visit to Sissinghurst, to catch up with Troy Scott-Smith and the changes that have been made to the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that the rambling roses have finished flowering, Monty turns his attention to pruning and tying in new growth for a good display next year. On the 20th anniversary of the death of Geoff Hamilton, Adam Frost returns to the famous `Gardeners' World' location, Barnsdale, to pay tribute and to revisit some his own early gardening memories. Also, we travel to Abergavenny to visit the garden of a sweet pea enthusiast to get her top tips for growing the best blooms.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift pays a visit to the Northumberland garden of Chris Mullin who, after over twenty years as a Member of Parliament, has turned his attention to the renovation of his walled garden. And National Trust head gardener, Alan Power, catches up with the transformation of Shakespeare's New Place garden in Stratford-upon-Avon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that birds are no longer nesting in hedges, now is the time to get them looking trim and neat and Monty has plenty of tips on how to cut them so that they grow well. Alan Power visits Croome Park in Worcestershire to discover more about one of the first great landscapes of Capability Brown and we visit a couple in Gloucestershire whose ornamental grass garden was inspired by the Far East.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow giving advice on how to deal with unruly roses, taking cuttings of herbs and planting a new tree. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families, exploring some of the most popular relations of the rose and we pay a visit to an orchard in Worcestershire to find out how enthusiasts are caring for one of the rose family members - the plum.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty Don helps six different families realise their dream of returning to the land. They're all determined to leave the rat race behind and transform their lives. With over forty years' experience of farming, Monty Don is on hand to guide the novices through their first, tentative steps. The first episode features Dick and Pauline Beijen, who gave up their executive lifestyle and moved from Dick's native Holland to Devon.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Having tires of their stressful city life, Rob and Sue Wood moved from the London suburbs to a windswept corner of Cornwall to pursue Rob's dream of living a more self-sufficient life. While renting a tiny smallholding costing them a whopping £1,200 a month, they hope to earn their living from the land. However, if that wasn't challenge enough, Sue is heavily pregnant with two young children already to care for.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty meets Karon and Simon, who have grand plans to rear rare-breed pigs in Suffolk.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with seasonal jobs at Longmeadow when he divides some perennials and plants alpines for spring colour. He also travels to Dublin to meet Helen Dillon to find out why she is planning to leave her world famous garden after decades of honing it to perfection. In Scotland, Joe Swift begins his quest to find out why we should rekindle our love for rock gardens.
