programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Dog's birthday, and he plans to celebrate in the same way he has for the last twenty years. There's no taking the day off to indulge himself for this bounty hunter--he's tracking down a fugitive!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For months, this fugitive has been stringing Leland along with a series of barely believable excuses. Out of patience, Leland calls in the Big Dog. The team whole team heads out to put pressure on the family and friends of this imposing 300-pound felon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Fugitive beware: Dog's rolling with extra power today. His old friends Tim Chapman and Sonny Westbrook are riding with the team, so their target, a thief with violent tendencies, is out of luck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: "When you don't write the bond, you don't know the prey," as Dog always says. So when Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Dog decides to spend the day caring for his newest granddaughter, Beth enlists the girls to hunt down a female fugitive. Heading into a dangerous part of town the ladies will use their feminine wiles to track this mother gone wrong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Dog's birthday, and he plans to celebrate in the same way he has for the last twenty years. There's no taking the day off to indulge himself for this bounty hunter--he's tracking down a fugitive!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog leads the team on another adrenaline-filled chase in Denver. The fugitive, Robert, has a habit of address-hopping that makes him a difficult target, but Dog refuses to give up and finally tracks Robert down in his latest hideaway.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's relentless ruthlessness is being put to the test on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog is tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call you good friend Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been raining for days and the team is going a little stir crazy. Dog however has the cure--a good hunt. Maui has failed to appear on a drug charge and the team has just one lead.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog finds himself looking for more than one fugitive. He starts the day looking for a woman who has skipped out on her court date.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa's wedding is only three days away, but Dog is thinking about bounties, not bouquets. A hot jump has comes in and Dog wants to go on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Two different young men; one has a taste for larceny, the other for strong sprits, both have a bad bad habit of missing their court dates.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For a guy who started life as a free spirited outlaw-biker Dog has certainly turned into a family man. His children touch everything he does today, from searching for the perfect gift for his daughter Cecily's birthday to hunting a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When can a bounty hunt also be a date? When Dog and Beth decide to ride in the same SUV as they pursue a run away fugitive, will their different approaches to the investigation lead to a capture and romance?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~£1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The Dovecote is a bistro in the heart of rural Devon run by a family at breaking point. The restaurant is on its last legs - they've run out of customers, money and hope. Enter Gordon, who on his first visit to the bistro is confronted with hideous wallpaper, vacuum packed lamb and a pig-headed head chef and owner who can't face up to his mistakes. Gordon has a torrid time putting them on the road to recovery, but come the autumn, they are sticking to his rules and business is looking brighter.
With the advent of the credit crunch, soaring food prices, thrifty clientele and unrelenting competition from the high street chains, Gordon is determined to galvanise the owners, the staff and the local community to ensure their survival and keep customers coming back for more.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Arriving at the limits of his patience and sanity, Chase makes a big decision; Carlos makes a run for access and status in the pod by opening up his own store, and takes Nick, a young inmate, as a protege.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: General population proves to be no walk in the park as the participants deal with shake downs, a flooded pod, unwanted attention, and dirty laundry.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: A new inmate enters the men's pod; Darius and Carlos work together to protect the pod and keep the peace; Rose attempts to help a rambunctious inmate who has been rubbing her the wrong way.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Rose grapples with devastating news; Trinity encourages the women to find positive ways to express themselves; Darius coaches the men on how to make money legally on the outside; the return of another inmate causes turmoil within the pod.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Carlos learns why he was removed from the program early; Darius struggles to keep peace in the pod; The serenity within the women's pod is shattered; the three remaining participants meet with the sheriff to debrief him on what they've discovered.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The participants reunite to discuss the highs and lows of their reincarceration in the Henry County Jail, and explosive arguments erupt within the group; Soledad O'Brien hosts.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The participants press Sheriff Scandrett and his team on the difficult conditions they endured during their time in the Henry County Jail; Shaquille O'Neal makes a surprise appearance; Soledad O'Brien hosts.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On November 24, 1990, 15-year-old James killed his stepmother and three young brothers with a shotgun, and then set their rural Wyoming home on fire.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On February 2, 1999, 17-year-old Ronald and two other teens sought to retaliate against Cordell for an alleged sexual assault ultimately burning him alive in the woods.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On March 31, 1998 in Albany, Georgia, 16-year-old Otis broke into Valerie's home and allegedly tried to rob her.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On August 21, 2001, a group of teens, including 15-year-old Brandon, kidnapped and raped Melissa, a 21-year-old college student in Youngstown, Ohio.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: In this special episode, we learn the final rulings for convicted murderers Otis Daniels, Ronald Bell, and Kristel Maestas. Otis' attorney works to strike a deal.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: Richard Kinder was 17 when he and a friend committed a robbery that ended in a young woman's death, and the serious injury of her boyfriend.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: This episode will chronicle the "DC Sniper" murders, and the battle over sentencing one of the most notorious juvenile murderers in American history.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.desc: A fire in January 2007 claims the life of WWII vet Bennie Angelo. A closer look at the crime scene reveals Bennie was dead before the fire, bumping an arson case up to homicide.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: The body of Lori Nesson is found in a ditch in 1974, yet her death is not ruled a homicide. After four decades, the cause of death is changed to homicide.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: In 1982 and '83, Seattle's Green River Killer stalked prostitutes like game. With 49 victims, he could be the deadliest serial killer in U.S. history.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic

programme.desc: Canadian police suspect that a former Toronto cop committed the crimes.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of serial killer Geoffrey Evans and his accomplice John Shaw, who hit headlines in 1976.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: From May until July of 1984, Alton Coleman and his common law wife, Denise Brown, engaged in a gruesome crime spree that spanned six states and left eight people dead including children. The FBI coordinated law enforcement efforts throughout the entire country in order to track the couple. Their expertise in conducting manhunts for the nation's most horrible killers paid off. The couple was located and apprehended as they prepared to kill again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at a trio of unsolved murders that occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas during the 1980s, details how a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident; it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy real estate tycoon went missing, it appeared to be foul play. In his will, he left instructions regarding what was to happen if he died under violent circumstances_which were carried out after a hiker came across a bullet-ridden skull.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly couple leave police stumped until, two years later, they receive a major break. A jeweler looking through old newspaper clippings recognizes a necklace the female victim wore as having been pawned in her own shop.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a street fight took the life of a national wrestling champion, police had to determine if he was killed in cold blood, or in self-defense. A jury decided it was murder, and sentenced the accused to a minimum of twenty years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two sets of scientists probe a woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island; they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Firefighters found an entire family dead inside their home, it seemed like a murder-suicide. But there were several inconsistent clues in the rubble. Could ballistics, a time card, and some secret audiotapes unravel the mystery?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, a small community in upstate New York was devastated when Patty Wlasiuk died in a truck accident. But burdock seed pods found in her hair and on her clothes would indicate that this was no accident. It was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island; they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal. An endocrinologist, a forensic botanist, and a short-order cook answer their question.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy real estate tycoon went missing, it appeared to be foul play. In his will, he left instructions regarding what was to happen if he died under violent circumstances_which were carried out after a hiker came across a bullet-ridden skull.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly couple leave police stumped until, two years later, they receive a major break. A jeweler looking through old newspaper clippings recognizes a necklace the female victim wore as having been pawned in her own shop.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 34-year-old nurse experiences a variety of flu-like symptoms. None of her doctors are able to discover the cause, until she visits the gynecologist for a routine check-up. Then she learns it's something far worse than the flu.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: When a beloved high school football player dies while shielding three girls from bullets in a random shooting, a city comes together to seek justice for a young life lost.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In 1989 in New York, a vicious assault on a female jogger sparks a racially driven witch-hunt for her attackers, and police employ aggressive tactics to coerce confessions from five young men whose lives will change forever.

programme.title: Find Our Missing
programme.desc: A nursing student disappears in South Carolina after a receiving a mysterious text message. A 7 year-old girl never makes it to school in Milwaukee. They are two of the countless unsolved missing persons cases in the U.S. Help find our missing.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a man is shot in front of his children, his cousin seeks payback, sparking a months-long feud between two families and a back in forth battle of murder and arson wreaks havoc on the city of Toledo.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a man is shot and killed soon after an alleged domestic assault, authorities suspect the girlfriend, but through their investigation they learn she did indeed seek payback, but it was not intended to be deadly.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: A brilliant teenager is discovered murdered in cold blood, along with her unborn child. A search for the killer sends investigators inside the world of adolescent drama, where they must unravel a web of lies to unmask the culprit.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When Air Force Sgt. Derrick Tolliver is gunned down in his home, he appears to be a victim of burglary. But the crime scene doesn’t add up, and suspects remain free. The case goes cold for three years, until a shocking confession reveals that, Derrick Tolliver’s untimely death was a result of a calculated betrayal that no one could have ever predicted.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Oakland, California mother Althea Housley struggles to put food on the table. So when her soul mate reveals a plan to make their dreams come true, she can�t deny him. And in Gary, Indiana Jeri Woods demonstrates to her ten children just how viciously loyal they must be to her domineering husband.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Chicwanda Forbes has worked hard to make a life for herself in New Orleans, until an older man offers her the attention she craves in exchange for her loyalty. And in Fort Worth, career-driven Carter Carol Cervantez begins to rethink her priorities when she finds love at the workplace.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When wife and grandmother Marilyn Brinson disappears in Kansas City, MO, a family is thrown into turmoil. A horrifying discovery leaves investigators fearing the worst, but conflicting stories lead them to worry this case will never be solved.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Alice Sin was a beautiful young mother dedicated to her child and her man, so when she vanishes without a trace from the small town of Pinole, California just days before her son’s first birthday, her friends and family are desperate to figure what could have happened. But answers won’t come quick—and it will take investigators nearly a decade to uncover the truth.

programme.desc: A masked gunman surprises a woman and her lover in bed. After a burst of gunfire leaves the lover dead, the woman says she can ID the disguised gunman. Detectives hope phone records can prove her right.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: In Ohio, Sandra Holling has always fallen for the wrong type of man. When she falls for the ultimate bad boy, her love pushes her to join him in his deadly fantasies. In Athens, Georgia, Briana Hood truly believes she has married the love of her life. But when her perfect man shows his true colors, her devotion to her husband takes her on a dangerous road.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Detectives are sent to an apartment complex to investigate when 38-year-old Cassandra Bryant is found nude and barely clinging to life. She dies in the ambulance before she can identify her attacker, leaving it up to Quinn and Velazquez.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: When Quinn and Vince investigate the shooting of Antwan Curry, they find a trail of blood leading away from the murder scene, meaning that someone else was hurt and fled. They set out to find this person, but is it another victim, or the killer?

programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan tackles cleaning a hot dragstrip with a flamethrower, converts a basketball arena into a hockey rink, and sets the stage on opening night for Orlando's latest live music venue!

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teen murdered but no suspects. A woman allegedly killed by a panhandler

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan embark on an epic quest to shatter their world record with a thrilling 16-hour performance marathon. Through wind and rain, they rock out in 14 cities, collecting over a thousand coats to bring warmth to those in need.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes the bad guys are busted by regular people! These stories showcase good Samaritans stopping suspects in their tracks.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Meet Gary and Karen, he’s a little adventurous, and she’s a little stay-at-home, but it will all change after 12 years of marriage. Kinga, Gary, and Karen embark on a crash course in adventure through the Granite State.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day venture to Verona and explore “the spot that’s more than a dot.” The guys play pickleball, dine on BBQ, get creative with splatter paint, and finish the day with a brew.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: After transitioning and battling cancer, Madison Wilkins finally feels comfortable in her own skin. Kinga goes to Orlando, Florida to help Madison let her hair down and experience adventure as the woman she’s always longed to be.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Marvel Actor, TikTok Fitness Mom, & Top Comedian Find Thrills at Theme Park
programme.desc: Our local experts know the best thrills at Fun Spot. Orlando’s top comedian braves the gravity-defying SkyCoaster, a monster DJ and actor can’t stop screaming on White Lightning, and an influencer leaves all her followers behind on the go-kart track.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Yesinia Melo of Jessy’s Clean Meals in Lawrence takes on Chef Jason Gentles of Sahel in Lowell in a spicy battle of the mill towns. Can Yesinia’s fresh cooking put the Jerk champion in his place? Or will Jason knock it out of the park?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Incredible stories of tenacious trailblazers making their mark in sports

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Discover Hub City’s mouthwatering bites, diverse culture and coziest corners.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Seafood starter, seafood main, seafood…dessert? Chef Janine Villalobos and Chef Aziz Bellarbi-Sala push the limits of fish-forward dining to try to ""catch"" the judges’ favor.

programme.title: Rickwood
programme.desc: This is the story of the oldest professional ballpark in the U.S. and the determination of its home team, the Black Barons. The voice of Rickwood tells the tale of its pivotal role in The Negro League, Black history and its legacy in American sports.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Having a little fun on the town is great but it's even better when you're doing it thriftily. Join Maddy & Dixie as they make a little cash go a long way, seeking out the best activities that’ll have you ballin’ on a budget!

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From inventors to marathon runners, interesting people are all over the country.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: New connections form in the most unlikely places. In this episode, chance encounters forge lasting friendships and transformative relationships.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Get your craft on with host Ashley Adams as she meets incredible makers and artists across America. Then join Ashley for her “Craft Course” on how to create something artful out of simple items lying around the house.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?

programme.title: Finding Adventure

programme.title: Julia Tries Everything

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In Milwaukee, 19-year-old Sade Robinson has gone missing, and her car is found torched. A trail of evidence across the city shocks the community and leaves her family searching for justice.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristy’s a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Maker Nation

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Heroes On Call

programme.title: Eat Play Stay

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Our awe-inspiring natural world can provide healing and beauty. But it is increasingly under threat from human behavior. Explore the mutually beneficial relationship humans can have with nature and how people are conserving the environment.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
